DOC.HEAD: Former New Orleans Mayor Dead at 60
DOC.TEXT: Ernest Dutch Morial, New Orleans's first black mayor, died early Sunday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 60. Morial was found slumped over the steering wheel of his car on Lakeshore Parkway, where he had been visiting a friend, at 11 p.m. Saturday, said Jinx Broussard, a spokeswoman for Mayor Sidney Barthelemy. Morial was taken to Mercy Hospital where efforts to revive him failed, Broussard said. Morial was mayor of New Orleans for two terms from 1978-1986. He not only was the city's first black mayor, but from 1967-1970 he was the first black to serve in the state Legislature since Reconstruction. Prior to that he was a U.S. attorney. From 1973-1977, he was a judge on the Louisiana 4th Circuit Court of Appeals.
